p:
An essential downstream effector of RhoA activation is Arp2/3, which directly regulates actin branching and polymerization to provide the necessary force for membrane remodeling in the absence of clathrin
63, 64 and highlights the role of actin dynamics in DAT trafficking. Actin depolymerization agents lead to reduced DAT surface expression in striatal tissue
49 . Piccolo, a component of the presynaptic cytoskeletal matrix, was shown to negatively regulate methamphetamine-induced DAT internalization, possibly through sequestering membrane phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate (PIP2)
65 .
